data.title: National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency
data.meta_description: View contract announcements for new NGA business opportunities.
data.text:
June 18, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a firm fixed price delivery order under the Intelligence Community-wide Enterprise License Agreement (IC-ELA) for Microsoft Enterprise Software to Minburn Technology Group, LLC of Great Falls, Virginia. The overall IC-ELA contract value is $15.6 million and provides services for a 12-month period.

May 24, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order for the Vertex-OASIS Pilot, under the General Services Administration’s OASIS indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity contract vehicle, to Booz Allen Hamilton. The task order provides 48-full time equivalents for staffing support and technical operations services across a range of mission-critical areas. The Vertex task order has a ceiling of $49.6M, a base year value of $11.8M, and three option years.

April 12, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order to Blue Tech, Inc of San Diego, California. The task order renews existing Quest software licenses and provides maintenance support for the applications. The initial task order award is $9.5 million.

April 10, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the Chinook indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity contract to Leidos, Inc. The contract extends existing services in support of software development, systems engineering, integration, operations and sustainment, and will be performed at Gaithersburg, Maryland; Tucson, Arizona; Chantilly and Fairfax Station, Virginia; and St. Louis, Missouri. The initial task order award is $33.5 million with a ceiling of $86.4 million.

March 22, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity Maru contract to Leidos, Inc. of Reston, Virginia. The contract extends existing software services that support modernized, integrated and interoperable analytic capabilities. The initial task order award is $81 million.

March 21, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity Summit contract to the University of Alaska Fairbanks. The contract provides the development, maintenance and provision of geospatial data and products. The total value of the five-year contract is $139 million.

March 12, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the Foundation GEOINT Modernization task order under NGA’s Blanket Purchase Agreement to Environmental Systems Research Institute, Inc. of Redlands, California. The task order extends existing cloud, database and software development services on Esri’s proprietary systems. The overall value of the two-year task order is $56.2 million.

March 6, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order for Red Hat products to Flywheel Data, LLC of Arlington, Virginia. The task order renews software licenses to enable dynamic scaling capabilities across networks. The renewal period is 12 months. The agreement is valued at $9.7 million.

Jan. 25, 2024

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded four indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity (IDIQ) research development contracts to Booz Allen Hamilton of McLean, Virginia; Lockheed Martin Corporation of Herndon, Virginia; Reinventing Geospatial, Inc of Fairfax, Virginia; and Solis Applied Science, LLC of Charlottesville, Virginia. The contract provides research and development services and support within NGA’s Research and Development Directorate. The total value of the five-year contract with a two-year optional extension is $794.1 million.

Dec. 22, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a time and materials and cost-plus-aware fee collection data matching fabric contract to Raytheon Company of Richardson, Texas. The contract provides development and sustainment of capabilities to connect geospatial-intelligence suppliers and user requests. The contract includes a one-year base performance period plus four 12-month options and the total value of the contract is $52 million.

Dec. 20, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity geospatial-intelligence modeling contract to BAE Systems Information and Electronic Systems, Integration, Inc. of San Diego, California. The contract provides development, integration and sustainment of analytic modeling capabilities, integrating or replacing those previously developed under the NGA Analytic Services Contract. The total value of the five-year contract is $183 million.

Nov. 30, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a six-month contract modification to the Acadia contract to Peraton Technology Services, Inc., of Chantilly, Virginia. The Acadia contract provides imagery science expertise and infrastructure support to NGA’s image quality and integration testing missions. Contract work is performed at NGA locations in Springfield, Virginia and, St. Louis, Missouri, and contractor’s facilities in both locations. The modification is valued at $24 million, resulting in an overall contract value of $130 million.

Aug. 30, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract modification for the research development contract to Booz Allen Hamilton Inc., of Mclean, Virginia. The modification extends the task order one year and provides research and development subject matter expertise to identify, explore and transition new path-breaking capabilities into operations. Contract work will be performed at government and contractor facilities in Springfield, Virginia; Fort Meade, Maryland; St. Louis; Dayton, Ohio; Denver; Las Cruces, New Mexico; Burlington, Vermont; Goodyear, Arizona; Manhattan, Kansas; Medford, New Jersey; Melbourne, Florida, and Princeton, New Jersey. The modification is valued at $52 million, resulting in an overall contract value of $362 million.

June 22, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a delivery/task order for ServiceNow Software maintenance to Carahsoft Technology Corporation of Reston, Virginia. The delivery/task order fulfills NGA’s requirement for cloud-based information technology asset management, automation IT management and change management workflows. The access to, maintenance and renewal period is 12 months. The agreement is valued at $7.9 million.

May 30, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract to Quadrint, Inc. of McLean, Virginia. The contract provides application, infrastructure and security accreditation services to support NGA’s corporate business systems, databases and applications. The total value of the contract is $275 million, including a base year value of $7.7 million for the first task order. Additional task orders will be issued based on agency needs over the 7 year contract ordering period.

May 25, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded multiple indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contracts to companies to provide support to NGA’s total lifecycle acquisition management, strategic financial management and strategic business management activities. The companies include Credence Dynamo Solutions, LLC of Vienna, Virginia; Compass, Incorporated of Winchester, Virginia; Exacta Solutions, LLC of Arlington, Virginia; Innovate Now, LLC of Beavercreek, Ohio; and Logic Gate, LLC of Chantilly, Virginia. These companies will compete for eight individual task orders across the five-year ordering period and $947 million contract value.

May 10, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract to the Bailey IT Consultants of Stafford, Virginia and LMR Technical Group of Dallas, Texas. The contract provides administrative and executive assistants in support of mission requirements. Each contract is a multiple-award IDIQ with a five-year ordering period. The total value of the contract is $92.5 million.

May 1, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded multiple indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contracts to 13 companies to provide contracted intelligence and foundational analysis encompassing the tasking, collection, processing, exploitation, and dissemination functions of geospatial intelligence. The companies include 3GIMBALS, LLC of Miami, Florida; BAE Systems of Rockville, Maryland; Booz Allen Hamilton of McLean, Virginia; Castalia Systems, LLC of Tampa, Florida; Continental Mapping Consultants, LLC of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin; Geo Owl, LLC of Wilmington, North Carolina; Leidos, Inc of Reston, Virginia; ManTech Advanced Systems International, Inc of Herndon, Virginia; Novetta of McLean, Virginia; ProCleared, LLC of Chantilly, Virginia; Royce Geospatial Consultants, Inc of Arlington, Virginia; Solis Applied Science of Falls Church, Virginia; and Thomas & Herbert Consulting, LLC of Laurel, Maryland. The companies above will compete for individual task orders across the seven-year ordering period and $900 million contract value.

April 20, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract to the Applied Physics Laboratory at Johns Hopkins University of Laurel, Maryland. The contract provides software, testing, integration, prototype demonstrations, proof-of-concept development and workflow development. The ordering period for the contract is five years with no option periods. The total value of the contract is $29.1 million.

April 11, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract to RiVidium, Inc. of Vienna, Virginia. The contract supports and sustains the NGA cybersecurity program. The contract award consists of a six-month base period with seven and half option years. The total value of the contract is $249 million.

April 5, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract to Vysnova Partners, Inc. of Landover, Maryland. The contract provides research mission support services including administrative, financial, strategic and program management support for existing and planned R&D programs. The total period of performance of the contract is one year plus four option years. The total value of the contract is $93 million.

March 30, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order to Oracle America, Inc. of Reston, Virginia. The task order provides a renewal of software licenses and database maintenance. The order is valid through March 2024 and is a valued at $22.3 million.

March 30, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract to Lockheed Martin Corporation of King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. The contract is valid for up to 5 years and is valued at $85.7 million.

March 16, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order to Dell Federal Systems L.P. of Round Rock, Texas. The task order provides a renewal of existing licenses and the addition of new software licenses. The order is valid through February 2024 and is a valued at $14.7 million.

March 10, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract to Azimuth Corporation of Beavercreek, Ohio. The contract provides technical and subject matter expertise for research and development programs, market research on state-of-the-art technologies, technical analysis of new concepts and capabilities and technology transfer and transition activities. The contract is for a 12-month base year plus four option years. It is valued at $143 million.

March 9, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order to Flywheel Data, LLC of Arlington, Virginia. The task order provides NGA with licenses to Red Hat products that enable scaling of capabilities across server networks. The order will last through February 2024 and is valued at $9.7 million.

March 1, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract for learning management and support services to Noblis Inc., of Reston, Virginia. The contract will procure contractor support for the National Geospatial-Intelligence College to develop and manage high quality learning solutions. The total period of the contract is five years. The value of the contract is approximately $78.9 million.

Feb. 16, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract modification to Earth Science Support to Applied Research Laboratories at the University of Texas. The contract ceiling has been increased to $171.3 million. The contract runs through December 15, 2026.

Feb. 16, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order for software maintenance to Textron/Overwatch Systems, LTD, fof Sterling, Virginia. The task order provides NGA with maintenance and licenses for software that is utilized as part of Integrated Exploitation Capability analyst workstations. The task order runs through Dec. 31 and is valued at $11.1 million.

Feb. 9, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract to CACI, Inc. of Reston, Virginia. The contract will provide topographic data store data conditioning and maintenance.

Jan. 31, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a modification to the Real-Time Service Increment 5 contract to Lockheed Martin Corporation of Boulder, Colorado. This modification increases the overall contract value by $43 to $57 million through February 2025.

Jan. 11, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract entitled Mantis to Raytheon Technologies of Richardson, Texas. The contract will provide the core capabilities necessary for imagery scientists and imagery analysts to perform non-literal imagery exploitation as web services and desktop applications. The total period of the contract is five years. The value of the contract is approximately $270.9 million.

Jan. 4, 2023

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract entitled GEOINT Search and Retrieval – Yorktown II to General Dynamics Information Technology, Inc. of Falls Church, Virginia. The contract will support NGA’s “Search as a Service” capability, encompassing program management, operations and sustainment, software maintenance, and software development, to include engineering and integration. The total period of performance of the contract is five years. The value of the contract is approximately $88.2 million.

Dec. 17, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded an earth sciences support contract to the Applied Research Laboratories at the University of Texas at Austin. The earth sciences support contract provides research, development, testing, evaluation, integration, operations and maintenance of earth science software, hardware and equipment requirements in two functional areas – geophysical modeling and geodetic surveys. The contract has an estimated overall value of approximately $54.6 million over a five year ordering period.

Dec. 16, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a software maintenance renewal contract to Overwatch Systems Ltd. of Sterling, Virginia. The contract renewal will continue to support the agency’s critical need to provide a standard geospatial toolkit to the Department of Defense Command, Control and intelligence community. The contract includes a one-year period of performance with the total task order value of approximately $10.6 million.

Dec. 6, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the User Facing and Data Center Services contract to General Dynamics Information Technology of Herndon, Virginia. The UDS contract will provide a full suite of user facing and data center IT services on multiple networks and security domains at multiple locations worldwide. The single award IDIQ includes an ordering period of five years and five twelve-month award term incentive years with a guaranteed minimum of $5 million and a maximum ceiling of $4.5 billion. includes a one-year base and four one-year options for a total period of performance of five years.

Nov. 30, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded the Oceania contract to Lockheed Martin Corporation of King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. Oceania provides operations and sustainment support to GEOINT capabilities throughout the system lifecycle to enable NGA's international policy of sharing GEOINT in a bidirectional, mutually beneficial way. The contract includes a one-year base and four one-year options for a total period of performance of five years. The total value of the Oceania contract award, including all options is $28 million.

Oct. 6, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a task order for enterprise data governance support under the Defense Intelligence Agency’s Solutions for Information Technology Enterprise indefinite-delivery indefinite-quantity contract to Technical and Management Resources, Inc. of Fairfax, Virginia. The enterprise data governance support task order will provide NGA with necessary technical support services staffing in database administration, engineering and management; data storage administration; software administration and development; website administration and development; systems administration; SharePoint administration and development; graphics; systems security configuration management; and software applications customer service. The SITE IDIQ awarded by DIA in March 2021 has a five year ordering period with five one-year option periods and contract ceiling of $12.6B. The task order awarded by NGA has a six month base period with three one-year option periods. The base year value of the task order is $2,385,208 and total estimated value of the task order is $19,409,062.

Aug. 30, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a Multiple-Award Indefinite-Delivery Indefinite-Quantity contract for Economic Indicator Monitoring to Ball Aerospace & Technologies Corp., Royce Geospatial Consultants, Inc., BlackSky Geospatial Solutions, Inc., Continental Mapping Consultants, LLC., and BAE Systems. The Economic Indicator Monitoring contract will be used to acquire products, data and services produced from unclassified commercial GEOINT on unclassified networks. This contract will address functional and regional problem sets within five areas of interest: objects of economic significance, high cadence transportation network improvement data, infrastructure monitoring, natural resources and human domain analytics. The contracts are awarded with a 5-year ordering period with a maximum value of $29,999,999 each. The initial minimum delivery orders are issued for $15,000 each.

July 30, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va. — NGA awarded a contract for GEOINT Enterprise Open Data Store to Jacobs Technology, Inc. The GEODS contract will provide design, development and sustainment for OpenDataStore services. The single award indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity contract has a seven-year ordering period and overall contract ceiling of $302.37 million. The contract work will be performed at the contractor’s facility in Reston, Virginia.

July 30, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va.— NGA awarded a contract for Safehouse II to Maxar Mission Solutions of Herndon, Virginia, and Westminster, Colorado. The Safehouse II contract will provide sustainment, development and management of current SAFEHOUSE applications for the period of a year with four, one-year option periods. The contract has a total period of performance of five years with a total value of approximately $61 million, including the base year and all unexercised options.

April 21, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va.—NGA awarded a contract for Oracle Software Maintenance Renewal to Oracle America, Inc. of Reston, Virginia. The Oracle contract will include software maintenance and support for multiple Oracle products for the period from April 1, 2021, to March 31, 2022. The total estimated contract value is $25 million.

March 22, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va.— NGA awarded a contract for the Corporate Automation Implementation Center to Deloitte Consulting, LLC, of Arlington, Virginia. This single award contract will support business process design and automation services for applications, systems, and services supporting NGA’s corporate functions. The contract has a total period of performance of five years with a total value of $16,249,595, including the base year and all unexercised options.

March 19, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va.— NGA awarded a contract for Geospatial-Intelligence Access and Information Sharing System Next to Leidos, Inc. of Reston, Virginia. This contract will provide identity, credential and access management services for NGA, the intelligence community and the Department of Defense. The contract has a total period of performance of 10 years with a total value of $187,476,531, including the base period and all unexercised options.

Jan. 14, 2021

SPRINGFIELD, Va.—NGA awarded a contract for Structured Observation Management, Automation, Augmentation and Artificial Intelligence Framework for Integrated Reporting and Exploitation to CACI, Inc. of Chantilly, Virginia. SAFFIRE provides development, integration, deployment and sustainment of enhanced SOM and computer vision capabilities for NGA. The Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity contract has a five year ordering period and total estimated contract value of $376.45 million.
